title: AI Command Definition
description: Schema for YAML files defining AI commands. For usage documentation, see USAGE.md. For examples, see EXAMPLES.md in the repository.
$comment: Repository: https://github.com/jgttech/ai-command-schema - This schema helps AI assistants understand structured command definitions. Documentation files: USAGE.md (usage guide), EXAMPLES.md (practical examples), README.md (overview)

command.description: The command name, must start with a colon followed by alphanumeric characters, underscores, or hyphens

prompt.description: The prompt or instructions to be executed when the command is invoked. May contain placeholders like %s or other command references

argv.description: Optional arguments definition for the command

type.description: The data type of the argument

format.description: How the argument should be passed to the command

default.description: Default value for the argument if not provided

validation.description: Optional validation hints for the argument

exists.description: For path arguments, whether the file/directory must exist before command execution

description.description: Optional human-readable description of what the command does

examples.description: Optional usage examples showing how to invoke the command

output.description: Optional output format specifications and constraints

format.description: Expected output format. Use simple, clear format names that are easily understood.

constraints.description: List of constraints for the output (e.g., 'no AI signature', 'under 80 characters')

precommands.description: Optional list of commands to execute BEFORE running this command's prompt

postcommands.description: Optional list of commands to execute AFTER running this command's prompt
